subject: Encode service object path with sdbusplus
commitMessage:
Encode service object path with sdbusplus

After service-config-manager switched to encode its object path with
sdbusplus, bmcweb needs to encode them with sdbusplus as well.

Tested:
Verified PATCH ServiceEnabled property of SSH and IPMI works.

Change-Id: I1d3317489617b609327847eaf1d40fbc5659e53c
Signed-off-by: Jiaqing Zhao <jiaqing.zhao@intel.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 69320d54efe41fa5b0947adab5702d9023cc1ee3
This is looking pretty close.  Couple super minor fixes, then this should be good to go.
This is only used in one place, please just inline it.
Nit, in modern code generally we'd prefer these to be string_view.  With that said, given these are constexpr, it's not a significant problem.
Using std::string_view here breaks calling which use implicit const char* =< std::string conversion, here I keep uses const char*.
const std::string_view =< std::string also exists though, so I don't quite understand your comment.

Sorry for not making this clear and there was a typo in the comment. I mean it breaks existing function calls that take `const std::string&` arguments as std::string_view cannot be implicitly converted to std::string. E.g. getPortStatusAndPath().

Implicit std::string_view => std::string  Error
Implicit const char * => std::string  OK
Why did this change?  Old code was better, and std::string can devolve implicitly into std::string_view.

I've tried keeping `const std::string_view` here, but the argument will be corrupted. Below is some logs.

Jan 30 17:35:19 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:35:19) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":412] Encoded service name dropbear
Jan 30 17:35:19 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:35:19) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":416] Encoded path /xyz/openbmc_project/control/service/dropbear length 45
Jan 30 17:35:19 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:35:19) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":322] netBasePath: xyz.openbmc_project.Control.Service.Attribute len: 45

Jan 30 17:44:47 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:44:47) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":412] Encoded service name phosphor-ipmi-net@
Jan 30 17:44:47 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:44:47) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":416] Encoded path /xyz/openbmc_project/control/service/_70hosphor_2dipmi_2dnet_40 length 63
Jan 30 17:44:47 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: (1970-01-30 17:44:47) [DEBUG "network_protocol.hpp":322] netBasePath: /xyz/openbmc_project/control/service/_6fbmc_2dconsole_40ttyS2
Jan 30 17:44:47 intel-obmc bmcweb[364]: 0 len: 63

I cannot figure out why it is happened... Maybe some lifetime issue?

Oh I found the reason, the document of `operator basic_string_view` of std::string says

> It is the programmer's responsibility to ensure that the resulting string view does not outlive the string.

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/operator_basic_string_view

In my code, the underlying std::string lives in the call to handleProtocolEnabled(), but as async_method_call() immediatly returns, it will be destoryed before the handler of async_method_call() is called. The underlying pointer of the string_view dangles and gives garbled data.

In prvious code, string_view always points to the inlined `const char*`, there wasn't such lifetime issue.

Passing `const std::string&` here won't bring extra cost as encodeServiceObjectPath() returns std::string.
Yep, that's a good point.  Old code had a lifetime issue.  Fine as is.
Does this need to be syncronized with any service-config-manager patch?
Right, it needs to be merged after https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/service-config-manager/+/52557
Please mention that in your commit message.
+2ing this.  Please merge when the pre-req is approved.
Now the pre-req patch has finally be merged, please help approve and merge this one.
Please make this accept by string_view, then the std::string construction on line 455 will not be required.

It's just a link to one of the comments here. You can expand all and search string_view in all the page, I've expained there.

In short, netBasePath is captured in a async_method_call(), but it immediate returns and the underlying string is destroyed when callback is called. There was a lifetime issue when using string_view.
What's the status of the pre-reqs for this?  Can this patchset merge?
